children.subject:
Okay, good, the data science major will be available to you. In fact, it's designed so it'll be available for current sophomores as well. (I read this on the Facebook Computer Science group). 

I would be extremely surprised if Data 8 is required for the data science major. You can learn all the material from CS 61A + probability part of 70 + basic stats (Stats 20 level). By the way, I haven't taken the course but watched all of last semester's lectures out of interest.

In fact, if you're interested in ML, even Data 100 might not be too useful for you. You'll learn the material through CS 189 + Stat 135 + CS 186-level SQL. Data 100, however, is great for (1) those who don't take these courses and (2) for those who take these courses, tying them all together. Look at the material and decide.

I read all the lecture notes over break and brushed up on unfamiliar content (Data Wrangling & Visualization). And I decided it overlapped too much with 189/135 (which I'm taking next semester).
Thank you so much! Also, just wondering if you know any information about when the Data Science major might be out? I've heard it could be out next fall.

Next fall, but more likely, end of the summer. Check the Facebook CS group for details.

Hope this helped!

Did you decide to take Data 8 or 100?

No problem. Also consider taking the Kaggle Decal at the same time. Data 100 and Kaggle Decal go very well together.

Source: My friend is taking both.

HI all, that prediction of timeline is incredibly optimistic. It definitely will not be available this summer, I suspect not fall either. Please ensure you're also fulfilling requirements for an alternative major. Planning degree requirements based on advice from a fellow anonymous student is not wise.

history.content: I'm interested in the upcoming Data Science major, but as of now, I'm not planning to take Data 8. By next year, I'll have taken CS 10, CS 61A/B/C/70 and Math 53/54, so do you think these classes would satisfy the possible Data 8 requirement for the Data Science major?
history.subject: Data 8 required for Data Science major?
